dc01-plane.description: Any way you slice it, a 5 hour flight with a toddler is a very long time.  God bless naps.
dc01-plane.title: Dc01 Plane

dc02-airport.description: There was no doubt that Felix remembered Grandma. Right from the airport, he was happy to be held by her, and to follow her around.
dc02-airport.title: Dc02 Airport

dc03-wagon.description: Felix LOVED Grandma's wagon. If it had been up to him, we would have pushed him around in it for the entire trip.
dc03-wagon.title: Dc03 Wagon

dc04-wagon2.description: Pushing toys in the wagon is an acceptable substitute, when all the grown-ups are tired of giving him rides.
dc04-wagon2.title: Dc04 Wagon 2

dc05-booster.description: Felix also appreciated the booster seat Grandma got him. It puts him at nice level, without subjecting him to the confining indignities of a high chair.
dc05-booster.title: Dc05 Booster

dc06-chips.description: At a Tex-Mex restaurant for Mother's Day lunch, Felix samples the tortilla chips. He approves.
dc06-chips.title: Dc06 Chips

dc07-salsa.description: The hot salsa, however, was not to his liking.
dc07-salsa.title: Dc07 Salsa

dc08-restaurant.description: We went to a lot of restaurants. Felix was a good sport about it, as long as he was allowed to roam around. How do those grown-ups manage to stay sitting down for so long?
dc08-restaurant.title: Dc08 Restaurant

dc09-moms.description: Grandma Harriet lives in Arlington, Virginia, just across the Potomac River from Washington.   It has good parks.
dc09-moms.title: Dc09 Moms

dc10-stroller.description: The weather was warm.  Sandal warm.  So Felix got some.
dc10-stroller.title: Dc10 Stroller

dc11-dad1.description: Being in a stroller is nice and all, but a shoulder ride is so much more fun.
dc11-dad1.title: Dc11 Dad 1

dc13-rubnose.description: What's up Felix? Your nose is itching?
dc13-rubnose.title: Dc13 Rubnose

dc14-mom1.description: We took advantage of the fact that Washingon has many more outside restaurants than San Francisco.  This is a very good one in Georgetown.
dc14-mom1.title: Dc14 Mom 1

dc15-mom2.description: Who did Mom spot, walking up the street with Grandma?
dc15-mom2.title: Dc15 Mom 2

dc17-cool.description: What can I say? California babies are the coolest.
dc17-cool.title: Dc17 Cool

dc18-zoo1.description: On Monday, we went to a great little zoo. Here, Dean tries to keep our monkey from joining his cousins.
dc18-zoo1.title: Dc18 Zoo 1

dc19-zoo2.description: The zoo had a huge petting area, with lots of goats and sheeps eager to be fed.
dc19-zoo2.title: Dc19 Zoo 2

dc20-zoo3.description: Felix kept his hand nice and flat while feeding a pony.
dc20-zoo3.title: Dc20 Zoo 3

dc21-mall1.description: You can't visit Washington DC and not go to the Mall, where the museums and monuments are. Here, Dean and Felix take a moment of solemn reflection in front of the Capitol Building, where the legistature legislates.
dc21-mall1.title: Dc21 Mall 1

dc23-butterflies1.description: We visited the Butterfly House in the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History. This nice orange specimen recognized Lucie as one of his own.
dc23-butterflies1.title: Dc23 Butterflies 1

dc25-carroussel1.description: Felix loved the carousel, but didn't quite feel up to riding one of the horses.
dc25-carroussel1.title: Dc25 Carroussel 1

dc26-carroussel2.description: How can one resist a baby enthusiastically doing his "more" sign? Felix and Dean take another carousel ride.
dc26-carroussel2.title: Dc26 Carroussel 2

dc28-sculptures2.description: Even better than scupltures is dad telling you all about them.
dc28-sculptures2.title: Dc28 Sculptures 2

dc29-chilling1.description: Even with a busy schedule of cultural attractions, Felix makes time to hit the local playgrounds.
dc29-chilling1.title: Dc29 Chilling 1

dc30-chilling2.description: Nothing like sitting back on the edge of the sandbox, and contemplating what a nice vacation you are having.
dc30-chilling2.title: Dc30 Chilling 2

description:
Mother's Day saw the Moses family visiting Grandma Harriet in Washington DC. The five day trip was a great little vacation! Lots of baby activities during the day, and lots of going out for Dean and Lucie in the evenings, while Felix hung out with Grandma.

New words:

  • [hand to ear]: Music, sound. Felix used this sign to decribe Grandma's stereo (and then displayed a lot of self-restraint by accepting NOT to play with all the tempting knobs). The next day, he used it in a mini sentence (hand to hear, then hands flapping) to tell us about the birds he could hear but not see in the park.
  • choo choo: Tram, like the railcars that go in front of our apartment. He also used it in a sentence: in the airport, Felix was pointing to the planes and flapping his arms (his bird sign). When we boarded our plane, and he immediately got the point: he flapped and said "choo choo". Flying tram!
  • one, two , three, four, five: Grandma Harriet was counting steps while helping Felix climb up stairs. To our surprise, he flawlessly counted along, from 1 to 5. He has not repeated the performance.
title: May 13
